attributes.additional_details: With the cost of living rising, the £2 fare cap provides essential relief for families, students, and workers who need affordable, reliable transport to reach work, education, and services. Raising fares would only increase financial strain and discourage public transport use at a time when we should be doing everything possible to make it accessible to all.
attributes.background: Keep the £2 bus fare cap, as raising it to £3 would make public transport unaffordable for many who rely on it daily, especially low-income households and people in rural areas. Affordable fares are essential to keeping public transport accessible, reducing car usage, and cutting carbon emissions.

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign the following petition, which calls for similar action:

Reverse decision to increase the cap on bus fares from £2 to £3.
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/701368
